extendedInfo.description: No root required!This app will install Debian or Ubuntu onto your device.You will need a mouse or stylus to use it.Contains bugs! If you need stable desktop environment for everyday use - you'd better search for another Linux installer, there are several such apps on Google Play, all of them require rooted device.GIMP image editor, or office suite pre-installed (AbiWord and Gnumeric, there's no PowerPoint support).You will need 200 Mb free on internal data storage, plus 500 Mb on SD card.This app is NOT full Ubuntu OS - it is a compatibility layer, which allows you to run Ubuntu applications.Your phone is NOT rooted during installation. This is NOT official Ubuntu.com release.There are several limitations:- It cannot mess up your Android device. It is a plain regular Android app, so you can close or kill it when you desire.- Desktop environment is somewhat broken.- Video output is slow. This can be improved by creating native Android X.org server (Xsdl is a good place to start).- No audio support. Maybe it will be added in the future, however it will lag a lot, and there's no way to fix the lag.- No hardware mouse support. Probably it will be added in the future.- No OpenGL support. It's possible to add it but it's a huge chunk of work, and I will not be doing that.- No access to the device hardware. That means you cannot re-partition SD card, you cannot burn CD-Roms, you cannot run ping or sniff your network etc.- No camera support. It's possible to add, however not worth the effort, since Ubuntu can access photos on your SD card.- No multitouch support - this is a limitation of Ubuntu itself.- No ability to move app to SD card.- No pseudo-terminal support, so XTerm and many utilities do not work.Sources available on developer site.

reviews.title: Awesome!
reviews.comment: Very strong application.  Shows alot of promise and it fulfills a need.  More developers should take this root a simply build a app around a use instead of rooting a whole device.
reviews.author: Christopher Ruff

reviews.title: Guess who`s gonna uninstall it?
reviews.comment: ME! It just doesn`t work AT ALL. It fails to make a VNC connection. It`s a waste of space on my device. LG Optimus L9
reviews.author: ilovemoar Krabs

reviews.title: Great idea
reviews.comment: I like this app, it\'s a great idea and nicely done.  The Samsung Galaxy Note II uses the S-Pen which draws a cursor on the screen when it\'s 1cm above the screen, so I think this should be another input method. When hovering it moves the mouse cursor, when clicking it clicks, also the pen has a button (I don\'t know if the app can detect the button) which could be used for right click or as scroll wheel.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not really ubuntu
reviews.comment: This is not Ubuntu. It maybe of Debian root but its not Ubuntu. The only thing that even works is gimp making this entirely pointless unless you just want gimp.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Crap!
reviews.comment: It doesn\'t work on my Galaxy Tab :\\ really wish it did...
reviews.author: Taylor Le Mott

reviews.title: Works great.
reviews.comment: Works awesome and I love that it comes with GIMP, that\'s the whole reason I got it. My only problem is that all the apps images show up in my gallery app. Please use some .nomedia files to hide system files.
reviews.author: Billy Jeffers

reviews.title: Needs work
reviews.comment: does not work properly on my asus transformer. If it makes its vnc connection desktop does not load and occasionally i see an open app like synaptic which i cannot click
reviews.author: Blair Chasteen

reviews.title: Great work!
reviews.comment: Now I just need a case with a BT kbd and I\'m set! I would love to see the process, as I do have some experience with LFS...
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good and bad
reviews.comment: Easy to install, and ready to go without any work from the user. Is not working on rooted samsung galaxy tab 7  problem with bin folder can\'t find sh.
reviews.author: JB Smith

reviews.title: Finishes, but nothing happens
reviews.comment: Downloads, says finished, then nothing. Run it again and it does the same thing. Vnc widget doesnt do anything either. Running on stock jelly bean xoom.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Very smart!
reviews.comment: I love this, brilliant idea! :)
reviews.author: Amun Omar

reviews.title: tf101 - not
reviews.comment: It runs perfect ot my galaxy nexus, but on my asus tf101 I get only gray picture, help, ideas?
reviews.author: Finrod FElagund

reviews.title: Cool app for phones and tabs
reviews.comment: It\'s not perfect at all, but I\'ve been waiting for it too long and it\'s here :)
reviews.author: Vlad Chereches

reviews.title: Limited yet Impressive
reviews.comment: Nice work, and thanks for doing this.   I would try to install a full Ubuntu distribution, but I can\'t figure out how to root my Samsung Galaxy S2 (AT&T).  This is a nice hint of what Ubuntu for Android might be like.  For me, GIMP and Gnumeric worked fine, but   Abiword would not open-- the command line mentioned some display or font problem.  Synaptic also opened up.  Impressive!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: The future
reviews.comment: Not perfect, but very good - can\'t wait to see how progresses, defined gonna vs 5* app
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Really!?
reviews.comment: Swear words in the package name. Guess they thought no one would see it, which is unlikely since it kept crashing due to null pointers. Not sure if it works at all. Uninstalled.
reviews.author: Kyle Cousino

reviews.title: Needs one thing
reviews.comment: It is very good but it NEEDS Firefox. It works fine on jelly bean
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Love it!
reviews.comment: I like everything I\'ve seen about it so far, but you should package it with libre-office and gimp (maybe inkscape) to get full microsofy and basic adobe equivalents. All three of those are open source, so I doubt there would be any licensing issues  You could also do with some anit-aliasing on the app icon.
reviews.author: David Allemang

reviews.title: Excellent for getting aquanted with linux/unbuntu
reviews.comment: Totally new to the whole Linux scene but so far this is awesome. I have a problem opening up my web browser thoug. Also says stdin: not a tty... anyone know how to fix...
reviews.author: Kris Heimerl

reviews.title: Easy Peasy
reviews.comment: I put this on my Android tablet while I was having lunch and by the time I was back at my workstation I was using Gimp and messing around in a Linux desktop environment. No root access is really handy, tap & double tap work but drag and gestures don\'t - navigate/interface fine with a stylus or wireless kb/mouse combo. Just a bit sluggish if I\'ve got a few apps working at the same time as this.   Samsung Galaxy TAB10.1 (GT-P7500)
reviews.author: Alan Warren
